subject: PE Today: Knoller, Moyers, And The Critics
body:
CBSNews.com













Tenet 
      "May Have Been Off" On Perle 
      Meeting Discussed On "60 Minutes"In the 
      interview, Former CIA chief 
      George Tenet talks about an 
      encounter with Pentagon advisor Richard Perle outside the White House, 
      which he said took place on Sept. 12, 2001. In a piece posted yesterday, 
      the Weekly Standard's William Kristol wrote that this could not be the 
      case, since Perle was stranded in France until Sept. 15. Tenet now says he "may have been off by a couple of 
      days." The situation left "60 Minutes" and CBS News with a decision to 
      make. [+ Read More]



The 
      Brave New World Of Journalism In ChinaWe asked CBS News Correspondent Barry 
      Petersen what covering China is like under the new rules put in place 
      for foreign journalists in the run-up to the Beijing 2008 Summer Olympics. 
      Check out his report. Notes Petersen: "it used to really spice up a 
      mediocre story to say you had been 'detained by local authorities for 
      x-number of hours.' Extra, added drama…alas, no more." [+ Read More]



Knoller 
      Faces Moyers, And His Critics
Mark Knoller took issue with Bill 
      Moyers' critique of the performance of the press in the run-up to the Iraq 
      war. And a large number of commenters then took issue with Knoller. A 
      media-related war of words, in three parts. 
        [+ Read More]
